original_title: Tighter rules for Sri Lanka’s gov employees after allowance increase
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – A new circular has been issued for government employees, to ensure an efficient and productive service is provided to the public, the Department of Government Information said.
According to this circular, it is now mandatory for office-bound government employees to be present in their offices from 8.30 am to 4.15 pm and perform their duties.
Government offices should be open for money transactions until 3 pm.
Government employees should wear uniforms if provided, should display their office ID while on duty, and should be polite and courteous in providing services to the public, the circular specified.
Government sector workers are to receive a cost-of-living allowance increase of 5,000 rupees from this month.

The circular said it was essential that state workers of all levels, from the lowest level employee to the secretary of the ministry, remain in the office on Monday, which is set aside as the public day.

“The Head of the Institution shall ensure that no leave is sanctioned for reasons other than illness or unavoidable circumstances on that day,” the circular stated, and that no other meetings, workshops and events should be organized on this day.
Government sector workers must answer the phone, the circular spelt out. (Colombo/Jan11/2024)
